text: 9/ People look at bubbles and see waste and frivolity
column4: but also possible that bubbles are critical for progress happens.

text: 8/ And not to mention the massive
column4: durable cos founded in the dot-com bubble: Amazon. Google. https://t.co/k495ub1TaQ.

text: 7/ Netscape lost the browser wars but brought us modern browsers! Windows 95 shipped without a browser (had to get a "plus pack").
6/ More: Brian Behlendorf created Apache while working on HotWired. Linus built Linux while working at defunct chip startup Transmeta.
5/ and their Kiva warehouse robots are built on tech developed at WebVan. The WebVan team just took over Whole Foods!
4/ WebVan was one of the most famous and spectacular dot-com failures. But Amazon today is partly run by ex-WebVan execs
3/ Dot-com gold rush gave us so much: thousands of people learned HTML. Critical mass got email addresses. URLs in movie trailers.
2/ Each failed co leaves a tiny sedimentary layer on which future innovations and companies are built.
1/ An idea I like: bubbles are good because they lay down infrastructure for the next generation.
